Yeah, it probably just depends on conditions. #3 was kinda iffy, and made =
out of noise. Here's another. I just now went out to Field Elemenary to che=
ck a locate request. A locate request is to notify us that someone is diggi=
ng somewhere in Littleton, and I have to verify that it will not hit any of=
 our burried fiber. This was far enough away to not "bother" Field's fiber.=
 Mostly I like to put these up cuz it shows you need nothing but simple equ=
ipment, just an AM radio, and I used the built in recorder, so not even rec=
ording from the speaker! It's so friggin' close to proof, but just can't qu=
ite get it there! Frustrates me to no end.
 
 Frank-S

I was checking out a =
little boom box here, and decided to do a quickie session using manual swee=
p of the AM band. This is at work(don't tell the boss!).  The one about the=
 male dog might refer to the mate to this female poodle we have now. For th=
ose unfamilar, our daughter in-law knows someone that rescues dogs, and she=
 was tryuing to get rid of some of her too many animals. The daughter in-la=
w at first gave us the male poodle a few weeks ago, but he was deaf, blind,=
 and someone, probably the puppy mill he came from, pulled all his teeth. H=
e was too much to deal with, he fell down our stairs twice, and we felt he =
was suffereing too much, so we took him to the Dumb Friends League. Now we =
have his mate, but she has most of her teeth, and can hear, see and is a li=
ttle sweetie. #4 is hopefully accurate.   Frank-S

nary to check a locate request. A locate request is to notify us that someo=
ne is digging somewhere in Littleton, and I have to verify that it will not=
 hit any of our burried fiber. This was far enough away to not "bother" Fie=
ld's fiber. Mostly I like to put these up cuz it shows you need nothing but=
 simple equipment, just an AM radio, and I used the built in recorder,=
 so not even recording from the speaker! It's so friggin' close to proof, b=
ut just can't quite get it there! Frustrates me to no end.<BR>
